decks.notes: The deck revolves around utilizing a combination of powerful creatures and spells to create a win condition without relying on lands. By utilizing cards like Goblin Charbelcher and Lotus Bloom in conjunction with disruptive spells like Disrupting Shoal and Force of Negation, the player aims to overwhelm their opponent with a sudden burst of damage or control. The deck also includes various control elements like Sink into Stupor and Jwari Disruption to disrupt the opponent's strategy while maintaining a steady stream of card advantage with cards like Waterlogged Teachings and Sea Gate Restoration.

The main strategy of this deck is to control the opponent's actions through counterspells, removal spells, and Planeswalkers like Narset and Teferi. The deck aims to stall the game until it can establish a dominant position on the battlefield, using cards like Supreme Verdict and Solitude to control the board. The inclusion of cards like Isochron Scepter and Stock Up allows the player to generate extra value and card advantage. Overall, the deck focuses on maintaining control of the game and outlasting the opponent's resources.

This deck focuses on disrupting your opponent's game plan while applying pressure with aggressive creatures. By utilizing cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Force of Negation to control the board, while playing efficient creatures like Overlord of the Balemurk and Psychic Frog to quickly close out the game. Consign to Memory and Ephemerate offer additional flexibility and card advantage. The mana base is carefully crafted to support the deck's dual color requirements and ensure consistency in casting spells. Overall, this deck aims to tax the opponent's resources and overpower them with relentless aggression.

The main concept of this deck is to use a combination of creatures and spells to quickly assemble a powerful win condition without relying on lands. The deck focuses on using cards like Fallaji Archaeologist, Hydroelectric Specimen, and Tameshi, Reality Architect to create a strong board presence, while also utilizing cards like Goblin Charbelcher and Lotus Bloom to deal massive amounts of damage to the opponent. Disrupting Shoal, Jwari Disruption, and various counter spells help to protect your combo pieces, while cards like Whir of Invention and Waterlogged Teachings provide additional utility and card advantage.

This deck aims to quickly ramp up mana and get out powerful creatures like Allosaurus Rider and Ghalta, Stampede Tyrant. Using cards like Neoform and Eldritch Evolution, the deck can search for specific creatures in the deck to create a strong board presence. The deck also includes cards like Pact of Negation and Veil of Summer to protect the combo pieces and disrupt opponent's plays. The key strategy is to assemble the Allosaurus Combo quickly and overwhelm the opponent with big creatures before they have a chance to respond effectively.

The deck revolves around quickly assembling the Amulet Titan combo using cards like Amulet of Vigor and Primeval Titan to ramp and search for key pieces. It also leverages powerful lands like Urza's Saga and Crumbling Vestige to generate additional value and mana. The deck aims to create a strong board presence and overwhelm opponents with powerful creatures and land combos, while also having access to toolbox options like Green Sun's Zenith. The deck's strategy is to efficiently ramp into its combo pieces and win the game through overwhelming board presence and strategic land use.

This deck focuses on quickly reanimating powerful creatures like Griselbrand using cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate. It also utilizes cards like Faithful Mending and Consign to Memory to fill up the graveyard and keep the combo going. The deck includes protection with Force of Negation and disruption with cards like Thoughtseize and Prismatic Ending. The mana base includes fetch lands and a variety of dual lands to ensure consistent mana fixing. Overall, the deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures.

The focus of this deck is to quickly establish board presence and apply pressure on the opponent through aggressive creatures like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Monastery Swiftspear, while utilizing cheap spells like Lava Dart and Lightning Bolt for removal and direct damage. The deck aims to maintain tempo by casting spells like Mutagenic Growth and Expressive Iteration to outpace the opponent and close out the game before they have a chance to stabilize. The mana base is streamlined to ensure consistent access to all colors needed for the spells in the deck.

This deck focuses on aggressive creatures and disruptive spells to control the opponent's board while applying pressure. It utilizes powerful creatures like Overlord of the Balemurk and Solitude to quickly take down the opponent while using cards like Thoughtseize and Teferi, Time Raveler to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of cards like Ephemerate and Flickerwisp allows for blinking creatures for additional value. The land base is diverse to ensure consistent mana sources for the deck's multiple color requirements.

The deck focuses on aggressive plays using artifact creatures combined with cheap artifacts and efficient spells to overwhelm the opponent. It also utilizes Urza's Saga to generate value and search for key artifacts. Cards like Cranial Plating and Shadowspear boost the power of the creatures, while Kappa Cannoneer provides removal. Tormod's Crypt and Engineered Explosives help control the graveyard and board, respectively. The deck aims to quickly assemble a strong board presence and disrupt the opponent's game plan to secure a decisive victory.

The deck focuses on generating mana and ramping up quickly to play powerful cards like Primeval Titan and Scapeshift. It uses cards like Amulet of Vigor and Urza's Saga to accelerate its game plan and combo off with lands like Gruul Turf and Simic Growth Chamber. The deck also includes utility lands like Boseiju, Who Endures and Tolaria West to search for key spells and protect its combo pieces. Overall, the deck aims to assemble its powerful combos quickly and overwhelm the opponent with efficient land plays and big threats.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly generate mana and combo off using cards like Goblin Charbelcher and Lotus Bloom to deal direct damage to the opponent. It also focuses on countering opponent's spells with cards like Disrupting Shoal and Spell Snare, while disrupting their game plan with Sea Gate Restoration and Suppression Ray. The deck aims to control the game while setting up for a powerful combo finish to defeat the opponent in a 1 vs 1 Modern format.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly using the Urza lands and Eldrazi Temple, and then controlling the game with powerful Eldrazi creatures like Devourer of Destiny and Thought-Knot Seer. Utilizing Karn, the Great Creator and Ugin, Eye of the Storms to further control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck includes versatile removal spells like Dismember and Kozilek's Command to handle threats. All Is Dust is included for board wipes, while Warping Wail provides additional flexibility. The deck seeks to establish board and hand control to dominate the game.

The deck focuses on using instant speed reanimation spells like Goryo's Vengeance to cheat big creatures like Griselbrand onto the battlefield. Cards like Ephemerate and Faithful Mending help dig for combo pieces while protecting your creatures. The key strategy is to quickly get Atraxa, Grand Unifier onto the battlefield to reduce the cost of your spells and overwhelm your opponent with powerful creatures. Using cards like Psychic Frog and Quantum Riddler, you can disrupt your opponent's game plan while setting up your own combo. Overall, the deck aims to win through explosive plays and overwhelming board presence.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through removal spells, counterspells, and powerful planeswalkers such as Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Teferi, Time Raveler. It aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy with cards like Force of Negation and Spell Snare while using board wipes like Supreme Verdict to clear threats. The deck also utilizes powerful creatures like Solitude and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury to stabilize the board. Additionally, the deck has a strong mana base with fetch lands and dual lands to ensure consistency in casting spells.

The deck focuses on using instant reanimation spells like Goryo's Vengeance and Solitude to quickly bring powerful creatures like Griselbrand onto the battlefield. It also utilizes card draw and control cards to protect the combo and disrupt opponents. With access to a variety of colors and a mix of creature types, the deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats and disruptive spells.

The main focus of this deck is to establish a strong control over the game by utilizing the powerful UrzaTron lands to ramp into big threats like Karn, the Great Creator and Ugin, the Eye of the Storms. The deck also aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan by utilizing cards like Thought-Knot Seer and All Is Dust. The inclusion of Eldrazi creatures like Devourer of Destiny and Sire of Seven Deaths provide additional threats and pressure. Overall, the deck aims to control the game and outvalue the opponent with efficient and powerful spells and creatures.

The deck focuses on quickly putting multiple artifacts onto the battlefield to take advantage of synergies with cards like Mox Opal and Springleaf Drum. It aims to flood the board with artifacts, while also disrupting the opponent's gameplay with cards like Metallic Rebuke and Engineered Explosives. The deck utilizes cheap and efficient creatures like Memnite and Pinnacle Emissary to apply pressure early on, while also having card draw options like Thoughtcast and Mishra's Bauble to maintain card advantage. Overall, the strategy revolves around overwhelming the opponent with a fast and synergistic artifact-based aggro approach.

The deck focuses on utilizing creatures with powerful ETB effects and disruptive enchantments to control the board and pressure the opponent. By combining hard-hitting creatures like Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd and Solitude with versatile removal spells like Prismatic Ending and Consign to Memory, it aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while maintaining a strong presence on the battlefield. Cards like Sanctifier en-Vec and Rest in Peace help to further disrupt graveyard strategies, making it difficult for the opponent to recover. The deck is designed to apply pressure while keeping the opponent off balance through disruption and control elements.

The focus of this deck is to control the game by utilizing powerful Eldrazi creatures and key artifacts to disrupt the opponent's strategy. By assembling the UrzaTron lands, this deck can quickly ramp up mana to cast game-changing Eldrazi creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and Sire of Seven Deaths. Alongside removal spells like Dismember and board wipes like All Is Dust, this deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent through resource denial and powerful threats. Additionally, Karn, the Great Creator provides additional utility through its ability to fetch key artifacts from the sideboard.

This deck aims to quickly ramp up mana using cards like Arboreal Grazer and Amulet of Vigor to efficiently cast Primeval Titan and other powerful spells. The key strategy involves utilizing land synergies, such as bouncing lands with Gruul Turf and Simic Growth Chamber to generate additional mana, and utilizing Urza's Saga to tutor for key artifacts. The deck also includes combo pieces like Scapeshift and Malevolent Rumble to close out games quickly. With the right setup, this deck can produce explosive turns and overwhelm opponents with a sudden surge of resources and threats.

This deck aims to quickly assemble the Amulet Titan combo by utilizing cards like Amulet of Vigor, Primeval Titan, and Urza's Saga to generate a large amount of mana and produce lethal threats. With the help of cards like Arboreal Grazer and Explore, the deck can ramp up quickly and search for key pieces like Scapeshift to close out the game. By utilizing lands like Gruul Turf and Lotus Field, the deck can also generate additional value and mana to overwhelm opponents. The deck's main strategy is to efficiently combo off and overwhelm opponents with powerful threats.

The deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and burn spells. It utilizes powerful creatures like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer to apply pressure early in the game, supported by spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment for direct damage. The deck also includes control elements like Voice of Victory and Static Prison to disrupt the opponent's strategy. With a mix of creatures, burn spells, and control elements, Boros Aggro aims to close out games swiftly and efficiently.

This deck aims to control the game by using ramp spells like Utopia Sprawl and Talisman of Impulse to quickly get out Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker. It also utilizes powerful removal spells like Kozilek's Return and Malevolent Rumble to clear the board of threats. The deck has a strong synergy with Eldrazi Temple and Ugin's Labyrinth to generate a lot of mana and overwhelm the opponent with big creatures. The key strategy is to ramp up quickly and control the game until you can cast your powerful Eldrazi creatures.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures like Griselbrand and using cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate to bring them back onto the battlefield for big plays. The key strategy is to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Force of Negation while setting up your own win condition through reanimation and efficient card draw. The deck's main goal is to create explosive turns by comboing off with instant-speed reanimation spells and overwhelming the opponent with powerful threats.

This deck focuses on a fast and disruptive strategy, using cheap removal spells and counter magic to control the board while deploying aggressive creatures like Ragavan and Phelia to pressure the opponent. Ephemerate and Consign to Memory provide additional value by reusing enter the battlefield effects, while cards like Solitude and Quantum Riddler offer versatile removal options. Phlage serves as a finisher, while Fable of the Mirror-Breaker can disrupt the opponent's game plan. The manabase is optimized for consistency and can support the deck's diverse color requirements.

The main concept of the deck is to assemble a powerful combo using Hydroelectric Specimen, Tameshi, Reality Architect, and Goblin Charbelcher to deal massive damage to the opponent without needing any lands on the battlefield. The deck focuses on using various counterspells like Disrupting Shoal and Force of Negation to protect the combo pieces, while also including control elements like Sink into Stupor and Jwari Disruption to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also includes card draw and tutoring effects to find key pieces quickly and efficiently.

The deck focuses on utilizing artifact creatures and cheap artifacts to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. It relies on generating mana with cards like Mox Opal and Springleaf Drum to cast multiple spells in a turn, while utilizing cards like Cranial Plating and Shadowspear to boost the power of its creatures. The deck also includes cards like Pithing Needle and Engineered Explosives to disrupt the opponent's strategies, while utilizing Tormod's Crypt and Sink into Stupor to control the graveyard and disrupt strategies that rely on it.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying artifacts and leveraging cards such as Mishra's Bauble and Mox Opal to generate mana and draw cards. By utilizing cheap artifacts and efficient spells like Metallic Rebuke, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with threats like Memnite and Kappa Cannoneer. Urza's Saga is a crucial card that can help fetch important artifacts while also generating tokens to pressure the opponent. Overall, the strategy of the deck is to establish a board presence quickly and disrupt the opponent with targeted removal and counter spells.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on utilizing a mix of low-cost aggressive creatures, burn spells, and token generators to quickly overwhelm the opponent and deal damage efficiently. The deck also includes cards that provide additional value by generating tokens, providing card advantage, and disrupting the opponent's game plan. By maintaining a fast pace and putting pressure on the opponent early, this deck aims to finish the game before the opponent can stabilize and mount a counterattack.

This deck focuses on using Broodscale Bloodchief's ability to sacrifice Eldrazi creatures to generate mana and trigger powerful effects. By utilizing cards like Kozilek's Command and Malevolent Rumble, the deck aims to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The inclusion of cards like Emrakul, the Promised End and Sowing Mycospawn provide additional threats and powerful late-game plays. Urza's Saga and Ancient Stirrings help tutor for key pieces of the combo, while cards like Blade of the Bloodchief and Walking Ballista provide additional utility and flexibility.

The deck focuses on utilizing Combo - Instant Reanimator strategy to quickly bring powerful creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier back from the graveyard and onto the battlefield with cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate. It also includes disruptive elements with cards like Thoughtseize and Force of Negation to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to control the game while setting up for explosive turns to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and win the game quickly. The mana base is designed to support the deck's strategy and provide flexibility in casting spells.

This deck focuses on assembling the UrzaTron lands to generate large amounts of mana quickly in order to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures and overwhelming colorless spells. The key strategy involves controlling the opponent's hand and board with disruptive creatures and removal spells, while also utilizing Karn, the Great Creator to shut down opposing strategies and Ugin, the Eye of the Storms to wipe the board clean. The deck aims to establish dominance early on and maintain control throughout the game to ultimately secure victory.

The deck focuses on using Amulet of Vigor and primeval Titan to create explosive combos that allow for quick mana acceleration and powerful creature summoning. Utilizing land tutoring spells and cards like Arboreal Grazer and Lotus Field, the deck aims to ramp up quickly and overwhelm opponents with powerful creatures like Malevolent Rumble. The inclusion of cards like Scapeshift and Green Sun's Zenith provide additional flexibility and utility to the deck, enabling it to adapt to various situations and pull off unexpected wins. Additionally, the deck incorporates powerful lands like Urza's Saga and Boseiju, Who Endures to further enhance its capabilities.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on flooding the board with aggressive creatures like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Guide of Souls, while using Ajani, Nacatl Pariah to boost their power and protect them. The deck also includes disruption elements like Goblin Bombardment and Static Prison to control the opponent's board. Seasoned Pyromancer and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer provide card advantage and additional threats. The deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a mix of powerful creatures and burn spells, often finishing the game before the opponent can stabilize.

This deck utilizes a variety of creatures with different abilities to create a powerful combo engine. By combining cards like Cauldron Familiar, Gilded Goose, and Samwise Gamgee with support from cards like Chord of Calling and Birthing Ritual, the deck can quickly assemble its key pieces and overwhelm the opponent. With access to powerful utility creatures like Yawgmoth, Thran Physician and Arachne, Psionic Weaver, as well as protection from cards like Sylvan Safekeeper, the deck offers flexibility and resilience in various matchups. The deck aims to outvalue and outpace the opponent through its versatile toolbox of creatures and combo potential.

This deck focuses on quickly combining reanimation and control elements to cheat powerful creatures into play. By utilizing cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Faithful Mending to discard and reanimate creatures like Griselbrand and Atraxa, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with threats early in the game. The inclusion of cards like Thoughtseize and Force of Negation helps to disrupt opposing strategies while setting up its own game plan of instant reanimation. This deck efficiently combines combo and control elements to create a fast and threatening playstyle.

The main concept of this deck is to create a powerful combo without relying on lands. By utilizing cards like Fallaji Archaeologist and Tameshi, Reality Architect to generate mana, alongside Hydroelectric Specimen and Thundertrap Trainer for added benefits, the deck aims to quickly assemble the Goblin Charbelcher win condition. The inclusion of control elements like Disrupting Shoal and counter magic allows the deck to protect its combo pieces until it can go off. Additionally, card draw and tutoring abilities provided by cards like Whir of Invention and Waterlogged Teachings help ensure consistency in executing the combo.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly with cards like Utopia Sprawl and Eldrazi Temple to power out Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and Devourer of Destiny. It also includes control elements such as Kozilek's Command and Ugin, Eye of the Storms to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The combination of powerful creatures and disruption spells allows the player to overwhelm their opponent with massive threats while maintaining control of the game. By utilizing a mix of ramp and control elements, the deck aims to dominate the game with its Eldrazi monsters.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly with the Urza lands to cast powerful threats such as Ugin, Karn, and Emrakul. It uses control elements like All Is Dust and Dismember to clear the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck aims to lock down the opponent's resources with cards like Disruptor Flute and Portent of Calamity, while also utilizing Kozilek's Command for additional removal and card advantage. The overall strategy is to control the game tempo and overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats from the top end of the curve.

The deck focuses on creating a fast and powerful combo using cards like Basking Broodscale and Glaring Fleshraker to overwhelm the opponent with large creatures. It also includes cards like Emrakul, the Promised End and Kozilek's Command to disrupt the opponent's strategy and provide additional win conditions. The deck utilizes cards like Urza's Saga and Ancient Stirrings to search for key pieces quickly and efficiently, while also including cards like Tezzeret, Cruel Captain for added versatility and control. The deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent before they can react effectively.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with key creatures, such as Griselbrand and Atraxa, Grand Unifier, then utilizing cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate to bring them back into play instantly. It also includes disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Force of Negation to control the game state and protect its combo pieces. The deck aims to surprise and overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats and efficient reanimation spells, while also disrupting their game plan with removal and hand disruption.

The deck focuses on utilizing instant speed reanimation spells like Goryo's Vengeance to bring back powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Atraxa, Grand Unifier from the graveyard. It also includes cards like Faithful Mending and Ephemerate to help cycle through the deck and set up combos. The deck also features disruption cards like Thoughtseize and Force of Negation to protect the combo pieces. By combining explosive reanimation plays with control elements, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with powerful creatures while disrupting their game plan.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly assemble a powerful combo using cards like Goblin Charbelcher and Lotus Bloom, supported by disruptive spells like Disrupting Shoal and Spell Snare. The deck aims to control the game with counterspells and disruption while ramping up mana with Tameshi, Reality Architect. It also utilizes card draw and tutors like Whir of Invention and Waterlogged Teachings to find key pieces of the combo. Overall, the deck focuses on generating a strong win condition without relying on traditional lands for mana production.

This deck aims to quickly assemble a combo involving Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Psychic Frog or Quantum Riddler, then using Goryo's Vengeance to bring back key creatures from the graveyard. The deck includes cards like Solitude to control the board and protect the combo pieces, along with cards like Faithful Mending and Ephemerate for card advantage and recursion. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Force of Negation and Thoughtseize to help protect the combo. The land base is streamlined to ensure consistency in mana production.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by slowing down the opponent's strategy with counterspells and removal spells. It also utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Narset, Parter of Veils to generate card advantage and disrupt the opponent's plans. The inclusion of Isochron Scepter allows for repeatable instant spell casts, while Solitude provides a versatile removal option. The land base is optimized for consistency and mana fixing, ensuring that the deck can smoothly transition through its game plan.

This deck focuses on assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Mine, Power Plant, and Tower) to generate a large amount of mana quickly. It then uses powerful Eldrazi creatures and Karn planeswalkers to control the game and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck aims to lock down the opponent's resources while deploying threats that are difficult to deal with. By utilizing high-impact cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Thought-Knot Seer, the deck seeks to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent to secure victory.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly building a board presence through aggressive creatures and utilizing cards like Goblin Bombardment and Galvanic Discharge to control the battlefield. The deck also includes disruptive elements such as Blood Moon and Ranger-Captain of Eos to disrupt opponents' strategies. Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Seasoned Pyromancer provide additional value and card advantage, while Ocelot Pride and Voice of Victory offer more aggressive options. Overall, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with fast, powerful creatures and efficient removal spells.
